commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iff50800476b47452ff907f2877400a8767bfd643

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774119
Change-Id: I712f03bd1dc33bd61bedf9ddea1a4ccffbedd53d
(cherry picked from commit d385ca82721cf4b4c5cd087b349d48ac318b4776)

commit_message:
test_virtio_scsi_attach: Improve the volume id lookups

This lookup previously looked at *all* volumes the specific user had
access to within the environment. A better approach is just to look for
specific volume ids that are attached to our test instance.

Change-Id: I2e53a2ded276c6f7f3d59c95904a0ee195ec2fab

  [libvirt]

  cpu_models = kvm64
  rx_queue_size = 1024
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://stack@%s/system
  cpu_mode = custom
  virt_type = kvm

  [libvirt]
  cpu_model_extra_flags = ssse3
  cpu_models = kvm64
  rx_queue_size = 1024
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://stack@%s/system
  cpu_mode = custom
  virt_type = kvm

> [2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b81ef269f2df4c95af63084db36afd40/log/compute/logs/etc/nova/nova-cpu_conf.txt#84-90

I guess something has changed since then because it was failing pretty consistently for me in Id91887bb5d75c36c9a3c6fa4ea297c20b442fd4a [1][2][3] without nova-cpu.conf being updated correctly [4][5][6] and this change has resolved these failures.

commit_message:
zuul: Ensure subnode n-cpu is correctly configured

Without this instances spawned on the compute subnode will use
the qemu64 CPU model.

Story: #2008726
Change-Id: Ibe64ef9c3e96456c93e00ce1e87214a2717103d2

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Note(elod.illes): lower constraint of 'requests' needed to be upgraded
to make lower-constraints job pass, which involves a lower version of
idna as it is upper constrained in that version of requests.

Change-Id: I659571d084247a6a180d5b665921791d3647038f
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489
(cherry picked from commit 3e5a18ca7c6386667a6b7d03a774bdf80f3f91d1)

[{'created': '2021-03-15 11:18:12.000000000', 'message': "Stop checking if context.is_admin in the policy check and enforce

As Neutron's policy rules are going to understand and use new
personas like system-admin, project-admin and e.g. reader roles, it
needs to be aware of those and simply checking if

    context.is_admin == True

in the neutron.policy.check() and neutron.policy.enforce() functions is
not enough. We need to perform all checks in such cases as well to e.g.
avoid giving list of the system resources to the user who has
project's admin role.

Related-blueprint: #secure-rbac-roles
Change-Id: I403ca661dceee17aff9295caf8721c4a237a58cf
"}, {'created': '2021-03-15 16:20:27.000000000', 'message': "Always perform policy checks if enforce_new_defaults == true

When new policy default rules are enforced in the config, we shouldn't
be checking if context.is_admin is true and stop performing checks if
that is True.
As Neutron's policy rules are going to understand and use new
personas like system-admin, project-admin and e.g. reader roles, it
needs to be aware of those and simply checking if

    context.is_admin == True

in the neutron.policy.check() and neutron.policy.enforce() functions is
not enough. We need to perform all checks in such cases as well to e.g.
avoid giving list of the system resources to the user who has
project's admin role.

Such change will require a lot of changes in the code (e.g. unit tests)
and as we are close to the release point, this patch left that
context.is_admin check logic in case when
CONF.oslo_policy.enforce_new_defaults option is set to False.
In next release we need to get rid of that check if context.is_admin ==
True completly and adjust all required places in code as well.

Related-blueprint: #secure-rbac-roles
Change-Id: I403ca661dceee17aff9295caf8721c4a237a58cf
"}, {'created': '2021-03-18 07:51:46.000000000', 'message': "Always perform policy checks if enforce_new_defaults == true

commit_message:
Always perform policy checks if enforce_new_defaults == true

When new policy default rules are enforced in the config, we shouldn't
be checking if context.is_admin is true and stop performing checks if
that is True.
As Neutron's policy rules are going to understand and use new
personas like system-admin, project-admin and e.g. reader roles, it
needs to be aware of those and simply checking if

    context.is_admin == True

in the neutron.policy.check() and neutron.policy.enforce() functions is
not enough. We need to perform all checks in such cases as well to e.g.
avoid giving list of the system resources to the user who has
project's admin role.

Such change will require a lot of changes in the code (e.g. unit tests)
and as we are close to the release point, this patch left that
context.is_admin check logic in case when
CONF.oslo_policy.enforce_new_defaults option is set to False.
In next release we need to get rid of that check if context.is_admin ==
True completly and adjust all required places in code as well.

Related-blueprint: #secure-rbac-roles
Change-Id: I403ca661dceee17aff9295caf8721c4a237a58cf

commit_message:
Configure crush rules according to the detected device classes

This change introduces tasks, modules and the proper flow needed
to manage crush rules (when specified via tht).
The implemented flow reflects the steps done by ceph-ansible when
crush rules are configured.
The modules are imported from ceph-ansible and a just a few changes
are added to make them cephadm/spec compatible.
The ceph_cli is extended in order to allow the crush_rule tasks to
run commands using --admin-daemon and the mon socket.

Change-Id: If51cdfab825c86cd78da4520cb130d93148a1d43

[{'created': '2021-03-19 14:43:50.000000000', 'message': "[TRAIN-Only] Specify default podman network

In a01366b8a932881eb02954f90870cc4dea1abb1a we didn't define the network
by default because we were still using podman 1.6.x. Now that podman 3
is coming, we have to define a valid network configuration or it throws
an error for every cli invocation.

Change-Id: I9954be4c6ec4cffc83c9f19e9ddb0fc195d2ec88
Related-Bug: #1898120
"}]
commit_message:
[TRAIN-Only] Specify default podman network

In a01366b8a932881eb02954f90870cc4dea1abb1a we didn't define the network
by default because we were still using podman 1.6.x. Now that podman 3
is coming, we have to define a valid network configuration or it throws
an error for every cli invocation.

Change-Id: I9954be4c6ec4cffc83c9f19e9ddb0fc195d2ec88
Related-Bug: #1898120

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 15:44:10.000000000', 'message': '[SR-IOV] Do not fail if ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" is not supported

Some NICs do not support ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" parameter. This is
not an API issue (ip-link or Pyroute2); the parameter is already
supported. The error is returned by the specific NIC driver.

A sanity check is implemented, reading the SR-IOV configured devices
("physical_device_mappings") and the excluded VFs ("exclude_devices").

Change-Id: If70de0a7112777ac4011ad42af0ac98969765011
Closes-Bug: #1918464
(cherry picked from commit 3a9e81bbb8e5a56bd69a1edf1d2922276841157b)
'}]
commit_message:
[SR-IOV] Do not fail if ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" is not supported

Some NICs do not support ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" parameter. This is
not an API issue (ip-link or Pyroute2); the parameter is already
supported. The error is returned by the specific NIC driver.

A sanity check is implemented, reading the SR-IOV configured devices
("physical_device_mappings") and the excluded VFs ("exclude_devices").

Change-Id: If70de0a7112777ac4011ad42af0ac98969765011
Closes-Bug: #1918464
(cherry picked from commit 3a9e81bbb8e5a56bd69a1edf1d2922276841157b)

commit_message:
Use normalized_cidr of the SG in the OVN driver

Patch [1] introduced new, read only field "normalized_cidr" in
the security groups' rules.
With this patch this new field is send as source or
destination_ip_prefix field in the rule's dict in case if
remote_ip_prefix and normalized_cidr are set in the rule.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/749158

Related-Bug: #1869129
Change-Id: Ib4be5790c8fee9d5b045389b41a377ebbf7e270f

commit_message:
ovn-migration: UNDERCLOUD_NODE_USER variable

The undercloud node user is configurable in TripleO and isn't always set
to heat-admin. This patch introduces an environment variable for cases
where user is different.

Change-Id: If65925ded1b5df2bfdcfba50445ff7d821c725d8
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
ovn: Collect OVN logs

Collect OVS and OVN logs on the jobs that compile OVS and OVN from
source. The directories containing the logs are different if packages
are used instead. The Neutron change [1] collects logs only for packaged
versions because OVS and OVN are never compiled in Neutron jobs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771658

Change-Id: I90d9a37a31c1c455ae47e3c0f4bd9b3c98241d34

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 06:03:57.000000000', 'message': "Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
(cherry picked from commit 5d5ff82bab1dfb12e6223446b1cf20db6a348f38)
"}]
commit_message:
Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
(cherry picked from commit 5d5ff82bab1dfb12e6223446b1cf20db6a348f38)

Add support for configuring designate DNS backend

Currently just a thin layer between the templates and puppet-designate.
bind9 is currently the only supported backend.

Change-Id: If97e16a125537c1b5d9f5cfac1de0ffae0edb99a

[{'created': '2021-03-11 08:23:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add posibilities to set ovndbs monitor interval

Add posibilities to configure ovn dbs monitor interval
in tht by OVNDBSPacemakerMonitorInterval (default 30s).
Under load, this can create extra stress and since the
timeout has already been bumped, it makes sense to bump
this interval to a higher value as a trade off
between detecting a failure and stressing the service.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/779919/
Change-Id: Id836676826f6e7c97ef8e3d665ab3e467ad055ba
(cherry picked from commit 9ece6f97af8837de65f993c56b9ae3041cff6731)
'}]
commit_message:
Add posibilities to set ovndbs monitor interval

Add posibilities to configure ovn dbs monitor interval
in tht by OVNDBSPacemakerMonitorInterval (default 30s).
Under load, this can create extra stress and since the
timeout has already been bumped, it makes sense to bump
this interval to a higher value as a trade off
between detecting a failure and stressing the service.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/779919/
Change-Id: Id836676826f6e7c97ef8e3d665ab3e467ad055ba
(cherry picked from commit 9ece6f97af8837de65f993c56b9ae3041cff6731)

commit_message:
Revert "Remove parameter nova::compute::pci_passthrough"

This should never have been merged.
It removed more than the deprecated param, breaking the pci config on
computes.
Also should have warned for at least 1 cycle before removal.
It also wasn't removed correctly as the pick remained in nova::compute::pci
so (IIUC) the deprecated param still works today if set in hieradata.

This reverts commit d845b6f0aefaaab0b65b32cd22ccda8c2c8ee6ae.

Conflicts:
	manifests/compute.pp

Change-Id: I5b3d9dbbd41d060134444609458b3e8bba606ae6
(cherry picked from commit e7f323a1f4fb37c5a8a70a123f08fc5e1e5a7843)
(cherry picked from commit 3f4d157b81e17582927c591303db399055fa44ea)
(cherry picked from commit 9d3eee4233b70da5b3ae735f755864053cefbc70)

commit_message:
Add monitor interval for ovn dbs

Add parameter for configuring the ovn dbs monitor interval. Under load,
this can create extra stress and since the timeout has already been
bumped. It makes sense to bump this interval to a higher value as a
trade off between detecting a failure and stressing the service.

Change-Id: I0572f02f1bb8e099ce7647bc2f2f9b095a9c390c
(cherry picked from commit 61c61c89ed6e9c7d8502a17e681b6648c9930c6e)

[{'created': '2021-02-24 12:14:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deletion of rfp interfaces when router is re-enabled

1. When dvr router is disabled and enabled back, the rfp
interfaces are deleted on the nodes without snat-* namespace.
This is due to creation of snat namespace during router
initialization stage on all the nodes. At later stages, since
the gw_port_host is not bounded on this node, external gateway
is removed which triggers removal of rfp interfaces and snat
namespace.
Create snat namespace only on the nodes where gw_port_host is
bounded.

2. In case of DVR SNAT, when the l3 agent is rescheduled to
another node, the rfp interfaces on qrouter-* namespace are
removed. Instead of calling external_gateway_removed() which
further deletes the rfp interfaces, the qg-, sg- interfaces
need to be unplugged and snat namespace need to be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1894843
Change-Id: Ic35c2f9bceacec8eeba67a2b1ea0cd0b0ffc72fe
(cherry picked from commit 393d484e07e53496ff068d14047c97d28febd03a)

commit_message:
Fix deletion of rfp interfaces when router is re-enabled

1. When dvr router is disabled and enabled back, the rfp
interfaces are deleted on the nodes without snat-* namespace.
This is due to creation of snat namespace during router
initialization stage on all the nodes. At later stages, since
the gw_port_host is not bounded on this node, external gateway
is removed which triggers removal of rfp interfaces and snat
namespace.
Create snat namespace only on the nodes where gw_port_host is
bounded.

2. In case of DVR SNAT, when the l3 agent is rescheduled to
another node, the rfp interfaces on qrouter-* namespace are
removed. Instead of calling external_gateway_removed() which
further deletes the rfp interfaces, the qg-, sg- interfaces
need to be unplugged and snat namespace need to be deleted.

To resolve unit test errors after clean cherrypick, the bridge is
added to the unplug function call in external_gateway_updated.

Closes-Bug: #1894843
Change-Id: Ic35c2f9bceacec8eeba67a2b1ea0cd0b0ffc72fe
(cherry picked from commit 393d484e07e53496ff068d14047c97d28febd03a)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Allowing for all types of boolean in extra specs

Allowing for <is> True, 'True', 'true', <is> False, 'False', 'false' in
'storagetype:disablecompression' to that retype won't default to
host assisted migration. Also checking that the array is compression
capable in a retype operation.

Change-Id: I79724532202a19d02bf624dde6b3ba0c53080f98

commit_message:
Move policy rules "deprecated_*" params to the DeprecatedRule

Oslo policy moved those parameters to the DeprecatedRule object in [1]
and deprecated it in DocumentedRule object.
To avoid many deprecation warnings e.g. in our tests, this patch moves
"deprecated_since" and "deprecated_reason" parameters to the
DeprecatedRule object.

That change requires also bump of the oslo_policy to the 3.7.0 version
as change [1] isn't available in oslo_policy 3.6.2.

Additionally this patch also changes simple string "Wallaby" to
oslo_log.versionutils constant.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.policy/+/766628

Change-Id: I3234e04f417171db0d90e3e70661cc69bff8a4b1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-22 09:30:14.000000000', 'message': "Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach [1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach [1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I9a16d80f361f223c4c5c8cdcf90e920abd89f679

commit_message:
[Train and older] Fix several CI problems

Drop support for Ubuntu and openSUSE in Rocky, since their jobs no
longer pass due to an issue starting Ironic Inspector. CentOS is still
supported.

* Update pyghmi to a version supporting cypher suites
  Without it ipmitool takes minutes on CentOS 8 to do anything.
* Install six explicitly since our scripts use it
* Use pip corresponding to the correct Python
* Do not reinstall the older version of pip in playbooks
* Use UTF-8 locale in install-deps.sh

On Rocky:
* Update doc/requirements.txt to match global-requirements
* Fix unbound VENV variable in collect-test-info
* Make existing jobs non-voting
* Make CentOS jobs voting

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/prepare_libvirt.yml
	playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/required_defaults_Ubuntu_18.04.yml
	playbooks/roles/bifrost-keystone-install/defaults/required_defaults_Ubuntu_18.04.yml
	scripts/install-deps.sh

Co-Authored-By: Michal Nasiadka <mnasiadka@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I539c56000a4f6359205290ac14b300340f55eec0
(cherry picked from commit 14332ab8c7c67b203c938e7eb1bf09a84e72d509)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 09:29:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix missing node facts with BIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=ironic

In Ussuri and earlier releases, the Bifrost custom inventory returns all
node fields as facts. Currently, most of these are returned as null.
This happened following the switch to openstacksdk. The plugin checks
for the presence of a properties field, and gets detailed node
information if it is missing. This worked with shade, but with
openstacksdk, the returned node object has most fields present but set
to null.

One of the most obvious consequences is that provisioning fails, since
the 'Deploy to hardware - Using custom instance_info.' task tries to use
the instance_info value of null.

This change fixes the issue by removing the check and always getting the
detailed node information.

Change-Id: Ia87c8332994f3b0f037ada953a299987bba246e5
Story: 2008394
Task: 41321
(cherry picked from commit 71e26d17283bfce7deebb36e0980b0d92f285abf)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix missing node facts with BIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=ironic

In Ussuri and earlier releases, the Bifrost custom inventory returns all
node fields as facts. Currently, most of these are returned as null.
This happened following the switch to openstacksdk. The plugin checks
for the presence of a properties field, and gets detailed node
information if it is missing. This worked with shade, but with
openstacksdk, the returned node object has most fields present but set
to null.

One of the most obvious consequences is that provisioning fails, since
the 'Deploy to hardware - Using custom instance_info.' task tries to use
the instance_info value of null.

This change fixes the issue by removing the check and always getting the
detailed node information.

Change-Id: Ia87c8332994f3b0f037ada953a299987bba246e5
Story: 2008394
Task: 41321
(cherry picked from commit 71e26d17283bfce7deebb36e0980b0d92f285abf)

commit_message:
Fix missing node facts with BIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=ironic

In Ussuri and earlier releases, the Bifrost custom inventory returns all
node fields as facts. Currently, most of these are returned as null.
This happened following the switch to openstacksdk. The plugin checks
for the presence of a properties field, and gets detailed node
information if it is missing. This worked with shade, but with
openstacksdk, the returned node object has most fields present but set
to null.

One of the most obvious consequences is that provisioning fails, since
the 'Deploy to hardware - Using custom instance_info.' task tries to use
the instance_info value of null.

This change fixes the issue by removing the check and always getting the
detailed node information.

Change-Id: Ia87c8332994f3b0f037ada953a299987bba246e5
Story: 2008394
Task: 41321
(cherry picked from commit 71e26d17283bfce7deebb36e0980b0d92f285abf)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-07 10:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-07 14:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2020-09-04 06:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2020-09-11 06:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I agree it would be nice to see the usage value within the rp inventory command, and the code looks great, but my (and melanie’s I *guess*?) concern is that if we force this command to fetch usage as well it may degrade the performance in a large scale environment. 

Integrating the usage info to the inventory server API may improve the performance as you wrote in the code comment, but my point is that retrieving the usage costs in the DB layer[1] in the first place compared to retrieving the inventory[2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/placement/blob/b905ba3ed56652acd9cbff969d76b5363fd5935f/placement/objects/inventory.py#L86
[2] https://github.com/openstack/placement/blob/master/placement/objects/usage.py#L41

…Any ideas to what extent real operators suffer from such performance degradation?'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-11 08:43:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> I agree it would be nice to see the usage value within the rp
 > inventory command, and the code looks great, but my (and melanie’s
 > I *guess*?) concern is that if we force this command to fetch usage
 > as well it may degrade the performance in a large scale
 > environment.
 > 
 > Integrating the usage info to the inventory server API may improve
 > the performance as you wrote in the code comment, but my point is
 > that retrieving the usage costs in the DB layer[1] in the first
 > place compared to retrieving the inventory[2].
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/placement/blob/b905ba3ed56652acd9cbff969d76b5363fd5935f/placement/objects/inventory.py#L86
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/placement/blob/master/placement/objects/usage.py#L41
 > 
 > …Any ideas to what extent real operators suffer from such
 > performance degradation?

It's hard to tell without access to a scale lab or similar, which I don't have.

I wonder could we ask someone to test this for us? I'll post to the mailing list and see. We could always add a flag to disable this behavior, however I'd be inclined to add that reactively (i.e. someone tells us there's a problem) rather than proactively, since no one ever says "OpenStack's biggest problem is that it's not configurable enough" :P'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-11 08:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> > I agree it would be nice to see the usage value within the rp
 > > inventory command, and the code looks great, but my (and
 > melanie’s
 > > I *guess*?) concern is that if we force this command to fetch
 > usage
 > > as well it may degrade the performance in a large scale
 > > environment.
 > >
 > > Integrating the usage info to the inventory server API may
 > improve
 > > the performance as you wrote in the code comment, but my point is
 > > that retrieving the usage costs in the DB layer[1] in the first
 > > place compared to retrieving the inventory[2].
 > >
 > > [1] https://github.com/openstack/placement/blob/b905ba3ed56652acd9cbff969d76b5363fd5935f/placement/objects/inventory.py#L86
 > > [2] https://github.com/openstack/placement/blob/master/placement/objects/usage.py#L41
 > >
 > > …Any ideas to what extent real operators suffer from such
 > > performance degradation?
 > 
 > It's hard to tell without access to a scale lab or similar, which I
 > don't have.
 > 
 > I wonder could we ask someone to test this for us? I'll post to the
 > mailing list and see. We could always add a flag to disable this
 > behavior, however I'd be inclined to add that reactively (i.e.
 > someone tells us there's a problem) rather than proactively, since
 > no one ever says "OpenStack's biggest problem is that it's not
 > configurable enough" :P

Actually, thinking on this more, I don't see how this could ever be a problem. The 'inventory list' command lists the inventory for a single resource provider, not multiple resource providers. There's no reason the response time should get exponentially worse in a larger deployment *unless* placement itself suffers from scale issues (in which case we're already in trouble, since every API will be impacted). The only significant performance impact we could see if related to the cost of making two round-trip calls to the API. If you wanted, I could spin up a thread pool or something to make these calls in parallel, but that feels like premature optimization and unnecessary complexity'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2020-09-14 04:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

> I'd be inclined to add flag reactively since no one ever says "OpenStack's biggest problem is that it's not configurable enough"

Right, much less people say openstack client's problem is it's not configurable. 

 > There's no reason the response time should get exponentially worse in a larger deployment

Well, I meant there is a use case that operators use the API for every RPs in a larger deployment to retrieve all inventories info in cloud, but... okay, since it can be well multithreaded if they want, I'm sold.'}, {'account_id': 26250, 'date': '2021-03-19 15:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-03-22 08:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

This looks good to me but I let Melanie approve it if she agrees.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-03-22 17:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

To the above discussion, I wasn't really concerned about performance impact with this proposal but rather wanted to understand more about the reasoning behind adding info from a different API (/usages) to this command (previously only /inventories) given the current state of already having /usages commands. I wanted to get more of an idea of the thoughts around the duplication and get some confidence that this is where 'used' info should be.

I think the explanation on this PS helps give the broader picture of this change and how it relates to what's already in the CLI. I could see us deprecating 'resource provider usage show' as at least I can't see what usefulness it has if we have the 'used' info in 'inventory list' and 'inventory show'.

The /resource_providers/usages API has been available since the initial version of the placement API, so it's safe to include it unconditionally in the 'inventory list' and 'inventory show' commands.

I tried out this change locally in devstack and it looks good.

Code changes LGTM, release note looks good, thanks Stephen!

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/placement-api-microversion-history.html#initial-version"}]

commit_message:
Include usage in 'inventory list', 'inventory show'

The 'resource provider inventory list' and 'resource provider inventory
show' commands describe everything about some given inventory *except*
their usage, which is a pretty important metric in quickly assessing
availability of a given resource. Instead, usage is hidden behind the
'resource provider usage show' command. There doesn't appear to be any
reason for this to the case, aside from wanting to directly map to the
placement API which shouldn't be a goal. Make these commands more
friendly by including usage information. We may want to consider
deprecating the 'resource provider usage show' command in the future,
but that's left for another day.

Change-Id: Iafedac3ff7a5ae60e6027741c44904babf64d3f1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a job to test tinyipa in ussuri

We create a test job for the original check so that we can leave that
untouched.
This is to avoid override-checkout conflicts when the job runs on ipa in
ussuri.

Change-Id: I1d710b252b177c0364e6fa8a1407695feeb46927

commit_message:
Do not write /var/log/ceilometer

This patch reverts If7b88bf51046317171f6fa85bb8c01390fa26a37.

ceilometermiddlware is supposed to use the same logger as proxy-server
and doesn't directly touch log files but rely on rsyslog.

Change-Id: I3e2a8ec96cb7b3befa6d840b0944b6f50203dd9e
(cherry picked from commit 35c905e430b494b462a68f57304e70f0938b4952)

'}]
commit_message:
Fix memcached restart on cert renewal

Memcached does not need to be restarted in order to reload new certs,
a single refresh_certs command will do. This fix will preserve cached
items and avoid cache rebuild.

Change-Id: Ida5faaf4685b111b3b07b4499b24d4ba3b6ec459
Depends-On: 593150ac9ce1aeb63e8cb88e47223973979b0478
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4586911ef793c6b28871963c0a1485d71dee48c6)

commit_message:
Make neutron-grenade-dvr-multinode non-voting

In neutron-grenade-dvr-multinode tempest.api.compute.servers.
test_attach_interfaces.AttachInterfacesUnderV243Test.
test_add_remove_fixed_ip failes often recently. Till the rootcause is
fixed let's make the job non-voting.

Change-Id: I73a0bef7dca08aec17ee764e0ed2ac86d88dc57d
Related-Bug: #1920778

[{'created': '2021-03-08 09:07:42.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

Sphinx requirements also fixed to make requirements-check job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663

'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

Sphinx requirements also fixed to make requirements-check job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: Ib2bad4cbd1ac9a63cd8c8e48f5cd5bf8c5cde595

'}]
commit_message:
Fix memcached firewall condition

The conditions should have used map_merge, this simplifies
them a lot, by passing a list to dport key.

Change-Id: I15cb1f3bbc9e1be90265feab5bfed7f28c1cb1f3
Closes-Bug: #1918891
Co-authored-By: yatinkarel <ykarel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix parameters for puppet-memcached-6.0.0

Rename listen_addr to listen; drop notls_listen_addr and
notls_listen_port from version 5.0.0, as they never made it
in into puppet-memcached-6.0.0.

Change-Id: I18bda6b9219ab42543f83c46be7763f98e4dfd0e
Signed-off-by: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Co-authored-By: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9be84a2fc268b2a8838f10d740d181e54ede6572)

commit_message:
Fix memcached restart on cert renewal

Memcached does not need to be restarted in order to reload new certs,
a single refresh_certs command will do. This fix will preserve cached
items and avoid cache rebuild.

Change-Id: Ida5faaf4685b111b3b07b4499b24d4ba3b6ec459
Depends-On: bc2b705aa595339b50346a0e916e78ea4f36714b
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4586911ef793c6b28871963c0a1485d71dee48c6)

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: Ie387720bee27f2d420fc00922de9e4ce8cf00744

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: Idead9b4198c6b05d72bae60dee06e5aebc223822
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489
(cherry picked from commit 1d7ca8a198419896346369311fccedea5a559f66)
(cherry picked from commit 3a22403be8f0c32581d108a2eb4d0674e9c00e40)

Add new options to PKCS#11 backend

This patch adds support for a couple of new new options in the
PCKS#11 backends.  Namely 'token_labels' and 'os_locking_ok'.

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

Sphinx requirements also fixed to make requirements-check job pass.

lower-constraints job fixed with
* correcting contradicting/missing constraints
* setting default install_command to not use upper-constraints.txt

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: Ib2bad4cbd1ac9a63cd8c8e48f5cd5bf8c5cde595

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-22 09:27:18.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie1d1fd622e566620324cd37e31e489538f634ddc
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie1d1fd622e566620324cd37e31e489538f634ddc

Left a comment inline about the removed option (haven't looked at anything else yet)."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2021-03-16 21:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Changing my vote as the configuration option has never been released to customers.  So, no need to deprecate.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-03-16 21:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

This driver is new in Wallaby (not yet released), so you can do whatever you like with the options!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-03-17 01:08:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

This patch looks good and has good unit test coverage.  Two followups:

1 - I suggest taking advantage of oslo.config when defining one of the options (see comment inline)

2 - you haven't implemented get_driver_options().  See this patch for how to do it: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/713683"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-03-17 01:21:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

The third-party CI results came in while I was reviewing.  Good news is no regressions, but I did note that you're not running the cinder-tempest-plugin that contains the revert-to-snapshot tests.  You need to enable the plugin and set volume_revert = True in the [volume-feature-enabled] section of tempest.conf.  So that's all that's remaining to do before this merges.  (The follow ups I mentioned in the previous comment can be done as bug fixes before RC-1.)"}, {'account_id': 30615, 'date': '2021-03-17 05:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-03-17 17:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-03-17 20:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
JovianDSS: add certs and snapshot restore

Added support of authenticity verification through
    self-signed certificates for JovianDSS data storage.
Added support of revert to snapshot functionality.
Expanded unit-test coverage for JovianDSS driver.

Change-Id: If0444fe479750dd79f3d3c3eb83b9d5c3e14053c
Implements: bp jdss-add-cert-and-snapshot-revert

[{'created': '2020-12-01 00:37:03.000000000', 'message': "Implement clean_dhcp_opts in neuton DHCP provider

Afther a node has been provisioned the DHCP options
on the neutron port must be cleaned up when the
'flat' network interface is used.

If the options are not removed a baremtal node, which
is statically configured to network boot (first) and
the HDD boot (second), may end up booting from the
network again after deployment.

Change-Id: I37bfb47312b371ccd5445f2660754c474d41433a
Story: 2008402
Task:  41337

commit_message:
Implement clean_dhcp_opts in neuton DHCP provider

Afther a node has been provisioned the DHCP options
on the neutron port must be cleaned up when the
'flat' network interface is used.

If the options are not removed a baremtal node, which
is statically configured to network boot (first) and
the HDD boot (second), may end up booting from the
network again after deployment.

Change-Id: I37bfb47312b371ccd5445f2660754c474d41433a
Story: 2008402
Task:  41337

subject: Adjust yes/no to be booleans
messages:
[{'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-02-24 15:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-02-24 15:27:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hopefully the last patch related to these booleans. I've re-tested this in a tripleo-standalone environment (including the changes to types and defaults in the deployment on my THT branch) and it all works fine together."}, {'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-02-24 16:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-24 16:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-24 23:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Could you explain why we need this change ?
The change is a bit concerning because it implements a breaking change in interface.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-24 23:29:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-02-25 14:37:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Could you explain why we need this change ?

So the code conforms to standards and is less confusing to use.

> The change is a bit concerning because it implements a breaking change in interface.

Agreed.

>

Hi Takashi, thanks for the question! I've been working on a re-implementation of the QDR deployment in Ansible, and discovered this abuse of truthy strings from the automated lint test in the Tripleo Heat Templates repo[1]. Kevin Carter also commented on it and I followed up with him to discuss the situation. These changes are a result of that discussion, which basically boils down to: Use true/false booleans where possible, as long as possible, before translating to yes/no strings. I've tested that the underlying service can accept either, so we now carry the booleans intact the whole way without converting to strings. This makes the code more consistent, standards compliant, and more intuitive to use and develop.

Hope that helps!

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/772920/1/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_metrics_qdr/vars/main.yml#35"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-25 14:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think the breaking concern could be alleviated by adding logic to handle yes/no and convert to booleans.'}, {'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-02-25 14:51:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 
> So the code conforms to standards and is less confusing to use.
> 
> > The change is a bit concerning because it implements a breaking change in interface.
> 
> Agreed.
> 
> >
> 
> Hi Takashi, thanks for the question! I've been working on a re-implementation of the QDR deployment in Ansible, and discovered this abuse of truthy strings from the automated lint test in the Tripleo Heat Templates repo[1]. Kevin Carter also commented on it and I followed up with him to discuss the situation. These changes are a result of that discussion, which basically boils down to: Use true/false booleans where possible, as long as possible, before translating to yes/no strings. I've tested that the underlying service can accept either, so we now carry the booleans intact the whole way without converting to strings. This makes the code more consistent, standards compliant, and more intuitive to use and develop.
> 
> Hope that helps!
> 
> [1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/772920/1/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_metrics_qdr/vars/main.yml#35

Minor correction - the original lint tests about truthiness were in the tripleo_ansible repo. While addressing them for the new ansible code, I got errors from the lint tests in THT saying that the legacy code must change to match so we don't have two THT vars with different types. After fixing THAT it became clear this code would need to adjust as well."}, {'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-02-25 14:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

well in THT we expect it to match what is needed in puppet-qdr. So backwards compatibility needs to be handled here and the we'd update THT to use booleans instead"}, {'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-02-25 19:15:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Thank you for updating the patch. The current version looks good. I'll put +A once I confirm that there are no plan to backport this.

If you want to backport this to stable branches then we should fix the current implementation so that this change doesn't trigger change of qdrouterd.conf without any change in puppet parameters. In general we should avoid change in conf files because that triggers restart of services.

'}, {'created': '2021-03-05 09:35:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add and unite required parameters for MgmtDriver SOL interfaces

As implement SOL interfaces for MgmtDriver, "vnf_instante" and "addtional_params"
are used as required parameters due to ETSI NFV-SOL001 v2.6.1 definition.
However, for various usage and functions in tacker, these 2 parameters are not enough.
Here the patch is aim to add required paramters for basic use of mgmtdriver interfaces.

Here is the final parameters to be used in mgmtdriver interface calling:

* vnf_instance
* request(due to interface to be called)
* grant
* grant_request

Note: Currently, grant_request is not passed to VnfLcmDriver, we are passing a Null
      grant_request in temporary. This will be fixed in X-release.
      (grant for terminate interface is the same)

Change-Id: I253d72ae09bd246ab3f1552185ce0a701a1f4b41

commit_message:
unite parameters for MgmtDriver interfaces

As implement SOL interfaces for MgmtDriver,
"vnf_instante" and "addtional_params"
are used as required parameters due to
ETSI NFV-SOL001 v2.6.1 definition.

However, for various usage and functions in tacker,
these 2 parameters are not enough.

Here the patch is aim to add required paramters for
basic use of mgmtdriver interfaces.

Thus, this patch is adding and uniting parameters
for vnflcm interface calling.

Target interface:
* instantiate(start&end)
* terminate(start&end)
* scale(start&end)
* heal(start&end)

Parameters after change:
* vnf_instance
* request
* grant(Currently None in terminate, need to fix in conductor)
* grant_request(currently None, need to do some fix in conductor)

Change-Id: I253d72ae09bd246ab3f1552185ce0a701a1f4b41

commit_message:
Convert docker molecule usage to podman

This change updates all uses of docker to podman and removes our docker
installation process from zuul and our local test process.

Change-Id: Idc4d4b0ab2557814d5aa2c543e4b7c546624b776
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 972b03943f31a5df0a8f02a06cc379c366dfa3bb)

PERC H740P controllers supports RAID mode and Enhanced HBA mode.
When the controller is in Enhanced HBA, it creates single disk
RAID0 virtual disks of NON-RAID physical disks.
Hence the user's request for VD creation with supported RAID
fails due to no available physical disk.

commit_message:
DRAC: Fix a failure to create virtual disk

PERC H740P controllers supports RAID mode and Enhanced HBA mode.
When the controller is in Enhanced HBA, it creates single disk
RAID0 virtual disks of NON-RAID physical disks.
Hence the user's request for VD creation with supported RAID
fails due to no available physical disk.
This patch checks the Perc H740P controllers whether it supports
enhanced HBA mode and if controllers are found in enhanced HBA
mode it converts back to RAID mode.

Change-Id: I9d295135e6059a47cb541ae1218b11c3d56f85e1
Story: 2007711
Task: 39844
(cherry picked from commit 325f28043468472c2f97f659c66817192aba39f7)

commit_message:
Add condition for the create_tap_service method in ovs_taas.py to check
the hybrid firewall driver usage. The change solve the 1919340 bug.

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tap-as-a-service/+bug/1919340

Change-Id: Iaafb5e636b8e05ea2c6926d5fac73224aee68d1e

[{'created': '2021-03-11 13:28:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2.0

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2.0 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iff47d5ebcc90a22afecec388556bb9db2118d233
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2.0

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2.0 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iff47d5ebcc90a22afecec388556bb9db2118d233

commit_message:
Fix the conflict status with hacking.

The conflict is caused by:
    The user requested flake8 3.8.3 (from /home/zuul/.cache/pre-commit/repozi7hytk7)
    hacking 3.0.1 depends on flake8<3.8.0 and >=3.6.0

Install the latest version of hacking to fix the conflict error with the
pre-commit hook.

Fix the bandit version.
To fix:

ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement bandit<1.7.0,>=1.6.0
ERROR: No matching distribution found for bandit<1.7.0,>=1.6.0

Fix the version of bandit in the lower-constraints.txt file to match
with the version in the test-requirements.txt file.

Change-Id: I504c93887413d5e19c5ffeb766dc8d047a5d357f

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: I2defac928ff0081b262ba31bdb9981274f13b32b

The driver version is bumped with regard to the zadara internal releases and tracking(like qa tracking). Could you please share updating the version is of any issue here??'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-24 15:02:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> > Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> > Addressing review comments should not bump the driver version
> 
> Thanks for taking a look Rajat.
> The driver version is bumped with regard to the zadara internal releases and tracking(like qa tracking). Could you please share updating the version is of any issue here??


Not that the version update is of issue but it doesn't tell us anything about what the new version contains (either a feature or a bugfix), it just states that version was bumped due to fixing community review comments which is very unclear and wrong."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-02-24 22:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

What Rajat is getting at is that the version of the driver currently in master is 19.08.  When this change merges, you would normally increment the version number.  Since this is a backward incompatible change (because of the refactoring, you can't just replace zadara.py currently in master with the zadara.py on this patch, you need the common.py etc files also), you will do a major increment, something like

  20.0 - major refactoring of the driver, plus added the following features:
         * volume manage and unmanage
         * snapshot manage and unmanage
         * etc.

I agree with Rajat that saying "addressed review comments" isn't really helpful here, especially since there's no way to determine from the diff of this version with the zadara.py in master exactly what code changes each of the intermediate versions (20.01, 20.12-01, ..., 20.12-24) correspond to.

If you need the version numbers for internal tracking and QA, maybe you can do something like this:

  Version history:
    15.07 - initial driver
    19.08 - Add API access key ...
    21.00 - major refactoring of the driver, plus added the following features:
            * volume manage and unmanage
            * snapshot manage and unmanage
            * etc
            Note: this version includes the following internal Zadara tracking changes:
            20.01, 20.12-01, ...

or you could put the internal tracking stuff in a comment after the class docstring.  The Version History is extracted from the class and added to the docs, so you may not want to clutter it up with too much info.

I jumped the version to 21.00, which is a little strange, but the driver already goes 15->16->19, so I guess the next major version number doesn't have to be 20 (as long as your support people know this and won't go crazy looking for the "missing" version 20 driver).

Hope this helps.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-02-24 23:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Update code layout and missing Zadara features

This patch changes following items of the Zadara driver:
- Changing the code layout of the Zadara driver.
- Using json format

This patch adds some missing features to the Zadara driver:
- Volume manage and unmanage
- Snapshot manage and unmanage
- List manageable volumes and snapshots
- Multiattach
- IPv6

Change-Id: I787e9e40c882e6ab252e10c239778019acb2e6c6

commit_message:
[stable] Drop lower-constraints job

As discussed in neutron team meeting [1], it is not worth fixing issues
identified by new pip resolver in stable branches. So let's drop the job

For rocky, update psutil functional test requirement (syncing with
neutron rocky version), as detected by new pip resolver. Also drop rally
job for rocky, as was done for neutron in
8fefd6e15ba84c6f52bc896e1b4f82f9752a25f8

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html#l-164

Conflicts:
	lower-constraints.txt
	tox.ini
	zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: I96c59b2e6697d65184e87b731682fd7441519c89
(cherry picked from commit d07317b60e6d46aabc3a6e878924923a07661e75)

subject: Fix root UUID for streamed partition images
messages: [{'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-03-20 00:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-03-21 21:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2021-03-22 10:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThank you Riccardo.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-20 00:32:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix root UUID for streamed partition images

The root UUID changes after a streamed partition image is written to
the block device, causing later deployment failure when assuming the
old UUID.

This change updates the root UUID after streaming the partition image
is complete.

This issue may have been missed in local testing because deploying the
same image repeatedly will result in stable root UUID across runs.

Change-Id: Ice4630c16fc216980488d1427f3b02e1b8a417fa
(cherry picked from commit e61336602f2f3054511dc9e381a7f0c1f18fda82)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix root UUID for streamed partition images

The root UUID changes after a streamed partition image is written to
the block device, causing later deployment failure when assuming the
old UUID.

This change updates the root UUID after streaming the partition image
is complete.

This issue may have been missed in local testing because deploying the
same image repeatedly will result in stable root UUID across runs.

Change-Id: Ice4630c16fc216980488d1427f3b02e1b8a417fa
(cherry picked from commit e61336602f2f3054511dc9e381a7f0c1f18fda82)

and call ensure_driver_resources() in init_host(),
will call self.driver.ensure_shares or self.driver.ensure_share to
update all share instances in that host. Currently, only NetApp and LVM
implement self.driver.ensure_shares, Other manufacturers are using
self.driver.ensure_share.
   in large-scale environment, there are lot of share instances in one
host. this will lead to take much time to ensure_share.
   so we can put this operation into the thread pool to speed up the
startup of the service.

Closes-Bug: #1909847
Change-Id: I295d0de0958ebfedd89441f1a2c1b447b74693a0

commit_message:
Put ensure_share into thread pool to speed up the startup of share service

   when we need to start or restart manila share service, will call
init_host().
and call ensure_driver_resources() in init_host(),
will call self.driver.ensure_shares or self.driver.ensure_share to
update all share instances in that host. Currently, only NetApp and LVM
implement self.driver.ensure_shares, Other manufacturers are using
self.driver.ensure_share.
   in large-scale environment, there are lot of share instances in one
host. this will lead to take much time to ensure_share.
   so we can put this operation into the thread pool to speed up the
startup of the service.

Closes-Bug: #1909847
Change-Id: I295d0de0958ebfedd89441f1a2c1b447b74693a0

[{'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-02-11 17:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2021-02-16 15:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks for doing this!'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-02-16 16:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-02-16 16:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-02-17 10:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2021-02-19 20:46:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Thanks for this patch Iury! I am not happy that there is inconsistency wrt to these backports, among the different OpenStack projects. In my mind, that [label "Backport-Candidate"] ought to be defined in one place in this repo, and then all these acls/openstack/*.config files could just use that label. Just like it is uses 'label-Code-Review', 'label-Verified', etc. We don't define those labels in this config file.

I can't in all honestly, +1 it. And it isn't your fault. I don't understand this project-config repo.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-02-23 20:02:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Ruby, I've talked with Clarkb to check if the labels need to be defined in each project, short answer yest.

<clarkb>iurygregory: the only labels we provide globally are code-review, verified, and approved\x0f
<clarkb> any other backport candidates or review priority etc you have to define per acl you wish to use them in
<clarkb> the trouble is that things like backports dont' make sense in all repos (not even within openstack)"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2021-02-23 21:07:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks Iury for getting more info about this. I will have to assume that they know what they are doing because it makes no sense to me not to provide a global label. Projects should be able to choose (or not) to use such labels, and standardizing/providing 'defaults' makes sense.

Regardless, there's only so much time and this isn't worth dying over :)"}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-02-25 20:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Inline comment for missing group prefix is the reason for a -1.

As noted on IRC I suspect that just using hashtags may be simpler (or conversely just using the label) rather than trying to combine labels and hashtags. But I think we can experiment with this.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-03-19 14:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-03-19 14:30:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-22 20:21:56.000000000', 'message': 'Support for marking VNF Lifecycle as Failed

This feature will enable the client to use an API
to mark a VNF Lifecycle Management Operation
occurrence as "finally failed".

It is based on the ETSI NFV specification where
"FAILED" is "finally failed". Once the operation
is marked as "finally failed",it can no longer be
retried or rolled back anymore.

  - As defined in SOL003, operation status can
    change from FAILED_TEMP to FAILED.

  - When VNFM receive this API , VNFM send
    Notification(POST) to requested node.

  - Regariding support od Fail Response parameter
    will provide with sepalated patch.

Change-Id: Ieb221c6e2dd4ed6c873123325efb95f09af4a135
'}, {'created': '2021-01-25 00:27:12.000000000', 'message': 'Support for marking VNF Lifecycle as Failed

This feature will enable the client to use an API
to mark a VNF Lifecycle Management Operation
occurrence as "finally failed".

It is based on the ETSI NFV specification where
"FAILED" is "finally failed". Once the operation
is marked as "finally failed",it can no longer be
retried or rolled back anymore.

  - As defined in SOL003, operation status can
    change from FAILED_TEMP to FAILED.

commit_message:
Support for marking VNF Lifecycle as Failed

This feature will enable the client to use an API
to mark a VNF Lifecycle Management Operation
occurrence as "finally failed".

It is based on the ETSI NFV specification where
"FAILED" is "finally failed". Once the operation
is marked as "finally failed",it can no longer be
retried or rolled back anymore.

  - As defined in SOL003, operation status can
    change from FAILED_TEMP to FAILED.

  - When VNFM receive this API , VNFM send
    Notification(POST) to requested node.

  - Regarding support of Fail Response parameter,
    will provide with separated patch.

Implements: blueprint support-error-handling
Spec: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tacker-specs/specs/wallaby/support-error-handling-based-on-ETSI-NFV.html
Change-Id: Ieb221c6e2dd4ed6c873123325efb95f09af4a135

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I7c598e3747fb8e8bee41f8bc0a296a3294a55742

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-22 11:59:34.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If13769a58af84a080c61337d2fc6ec3eb8f0a850
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If13769a58af84a080c61337d2fc6ec3eb8f0a850

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 10:34:36.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on
provnet ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver.
Without these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries
and won't send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries
will never arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core OVN
developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

(Manually cherry picked from Neutron b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I63853f1b01c9b7444ed592c871a60125fa64f098
'}, {'created': '2021-03-19 09:39:01.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

(Manually cherry picked from Neutron b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)

commit_message:
[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on
provnet ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver.
Without these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries
and won't send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries
will never arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core OVN
developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

(Manually cherry picked from Neutron b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I63853f1b01c9b7444ed592c871a60125fa64f098

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: I79f68c467d48b9b50143fd3a11e176f91804e805

subject: Fix deletion of rfp interfaces when router is re-enabled
messages:
[{'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2021-02-24 12:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2021-02-24 12:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Need some more manual testing'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-17 08:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2021-03-17 12:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck
Both the tests failed with timeout exception
neutron.tests.functional.agent.l3.test_ha_router.LinuxBridgeL3HATestCase.test_ha_router_process_ipv6_subnets_to_existing_port
neutron.tests.functional.agent.l3.test_legacy_router.L3AgentTestCase.test_router_processing_pool_size'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2021-03-18 05:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-03-19 09:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-22 08:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I just cherry-picked latest small update from the stable/rocky patch so I think I still can vote and approve that patch.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-24 12:15:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deletion of rfp interfaces when router is re-enabled

1. When dvr router is disabled and enabled back, the rfp
interfaces are deleted on the nodes without snat-* namespace.
This is due to creation of snat namespace during router
initialization stage on all the nodes. At later stages, since
the gw_port_host is not bounded on this node, external gateway
is removed which triggers removal of rfp interfaces and snat
namespace.
Create snat namespace only on the nodes where gw_port_host is
bounded.

2. In case of DVR SNAT, when the l3 agent is rescheduled to
another node, the rfp interfaces on qrouter-* namespace are
removed. Instead of calling external_gateway_removed() which
further deletes the rfp interfaces, the qg-, sg- interfaces
need to be unplugged and snat namespace need to be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1894843

(cherry picked from commit 393d484e07e53496ff068d14047c97d28febd03a)

commit_message:
Fix deletion of rfp interfaces when router is re-enabled

1. When dvr router is disabled and enabled back, the rfp
interfaces are deleted on the nodes without snat-* namespace.
This is due to creation of snat namespace during router
initialization stage on all the nodes. At later stages, since
the gw_port_host is not bounded on this node, external gateway
is removed which triggers removal of rfp interfaces and snat
namespace.
Create snat namespace only on the nodes where gw_port_host is
bounded.

2. In case of DVR SNAT, when the l3 agent is rescheduled to
another node, the rfp interfaces on qrouter-* namespace are
removed. Instead of calling external_gateway_removed() which
further deletes the rfp interfaces, the qg-, sg- interfaces
need to be unplugged and snat namespace need to be deleted.

To resolve unit test errors after clean cherrypick, the bridge is
added to the unplug function call in external_gateway_updated.

Closes-Bug: #1894843
Change-Id: Ic35c2f9bceacec8eeba67a2b1ea0cd0b0ffc72fe
(cherry picked from commit 393d484e07e53496ff068d14047c97d28febd03a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-22 09:27:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Add anaconda configuration and template

This change adds 'anaconda' group and 'default_ks_template'
configuration option under that group to ironic configuration file.
Along with this change a new boot_option named 'kickstart' is added
to identify anaconda kickstart deploy in the boot interface.

deploy_utils.get_boot_option method is modified to check if
node.deploy_interface is set to 'anaconda' and return boot_option
'kickstart'.

This change also validates whether required parameters are set when
the boot_option on the node is set to 'kickstart'.

When boot_option is 'kickstart' we also validate if the glance image
source has 'squashfs_id' property associated with it.

Change-Id: I2ef7c33e2e63e6d08c084b4c5dbd77a44ddd2d14
Story: 2007839
Task: 41675

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I878884d35c1dd811bfbb980d2b07c05116efac16

commit_message:
Add backup functionality to Conductor API.

It's a first step for moving backup functionality from Nova API to
Conductor API. Now there are only calls from Conductor to Nova API
as it is done for unshelve() method.

Change-Id: I000a1a7325face2030ab5a6800f94de42bdc859c

commit_message:
pci paththrough libvirt discovery

*parse the node device XML
*gather all VFs infomation to a list
*white list for pci devices
*DB models and db update
*add alias support

2004/6/26:
*enchance the alias
*provide alias to pci request converter
*proposal method to alloc devices
*test case failed fix: db

2004/6/24
*fix db testcase fail
*fix copyright info
*other clean up

2003/6/20:
* whitelist done:
note:
1)define white list as following:
compute_devices_whitelist =
      'bdf:0000:a1:1B.7,pci:vendor_id=0x8086:product_id=0x443'
2)define string could be repeate multi-times.
3)for PF, except you define bdf:..., will not load by 'pci:
  vendor_id=0x8086....

change: 2003/6/19
   1) alias testing
   2) clean up
   3) rebuild the whitelist
	design  done
        coding  begin

change: 2003/6/14
basic alias support (not finished yet)

change 2003/6/13:
1)clean up format domain of xml parser
2)merge VF type function
3)try fix db testing error, but still had 2 failed cases
	fk test failed
	shadow table test failed
4) clean up 'driver' of xml parser
5) fix resource tracker bug
6) rebuild all infulnced test case

Change-Id: I783866cfbe498a32130361c847617338b27fa8d6
Signed-off-by: Yongli He<yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Move pre_live_migration call to the conductor

This includes creating get_disk_info and
rollback_live_migrate_at_source compute RPC methods
so the conductor can call pre_live_migration.

A follow up change will look at moving the
post_live_migrate_at_destination call to the conductor.

Part of blueprint live-migration-to-conductor


Change-Id: I86ab3e1daa87d78be19ff53be0e119bf7621dd9e

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
messages: [{'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-03-22 10:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-22 09:28:39.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I292095c5e0c8831167c0493cd0105884d22ed1f9
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I292095c5e0c8831167c0493cd0105884d22ed1f9

commit_message:
The instance should still be resizable if the image is deleted.

If the instance is created from the image that is deleted afterwards
(and the information about it was also deleted from the db), the
instance should remain resizable.

Fixes: bug #1160773
Change-Id: I2a576fbf5e386207ad2dfafa23f92552061a7dfa

commit_message:
Evacuated instance disk not deleted

Added disk cleanup in case instance is not on shared storage
Adds new methods to compute.rpc and virt.driver interface to check
that instance files located on shared storage.

Fixes bug 1156269

Change-Id: If0fba7c4aa6c5e497a8c758af9dae4760d92c484

subject: ServiceGroup driver to rely on MatchMaker
messages:
[{'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-30 19:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-30 19:18:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

My own notes:

* I'm not too fond of how the lazy loading is done here. However, this is how the matchmaker is currently loaded in impl_zmq
* Better (ab)use of globals should be made, overall, because if the rpc driver already uses servicegroup, we might be making duplicate registrations and making duplicate heartbeats.

Side note: I'd like to make plugging into the matchmaker optional for kombu and qpid because it provides a nifty solution to message replay attacks when using trusted messaging. (The RPC drivers can't use ServiceGroup because it isn't in Oslo)"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-01-30 23:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

seems pretty straightforward. Simplification inline.'}, {'account_id': 2872, 'date': '2013-02-10 19:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Looks good to me, but someone else must approve.
Please bear in mind, that in order to add a new driver, you have to include its definition in nova/servicegroup/api.py.
See, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19008/9/nova/servicegroup/api.py'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2013-02-26 16:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-22 11:04:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
ServiceGroup driver to rely on MatchMaker

Oslo's MatchMaker provides parallel functionality
to the ServiceGroup API. When using both, it is
optimal that only one is actually used to minimize
the need to perform heartbeats and maintain external
databases.

Change-Id: Icbca4aa95195014f6cad9f3e5a6ed8d98a3f9041

commit_message:
rebuild-for-ha

This implements blueprint rebuild-for-ha

Evacuation of VM from a failed host for HA.
New api supports recreate/rebuild modes. With shared storage,
VM is recreated on the target from disk.
Otherwise, rebuild from original image is performed.

Change-Id: I4efe55a84645a30f66f413cd614e5387582577aa
